intro: Ruellia puberula, commonly known as the hairy ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Ruellia puberula is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
